p: Pregnancy was reported for 244 women between 17 and 59 years of age. Twenty-four (10%) of the pregnant women died. Of the 153 pregnant women with known vaccination status, 3 were vaccinated and 150 were unvaccinated. The risk of death was lower for pregnant women when restricting the analysis to the age group 17–50 years old compared with nonpregnant women of the same age group (IRR, 0.57; 95% CI, 0.38–0.85) and adjusting for reporting country within the basic dataset. No difference was seen between France reporting the majority of cases and other countries as well as between pandemic and nonpandemic seasons ( Supplementary Data).
